column4: i installed a webcam driver from the location http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=320433&page=2 6th post.the cam did not work but the icon came up as camorama webcam viewer.since the cam did not work i removed the camorama driver from the synaptic update. when i restarted my computer it was taking a long time about 6 minutes.and the lsusb command on the terminal is not giving any output.i installed bootchart to look what is happn
ing.but i cant see boot chart anywhere in the system to seek help about what is going on.guys thsnks for helping in advance
hi shawe
pastebin your dmesg. bootchart isn't the right tool for debugging
k, lemme look
afaics you're still trying to load a buggy driver. look at line 331+
can i do something to remove that , thanks
what did you do to install it?
so ok... so you were following instructions without knowing what you were doing.... pastebin your /etc/modues
/etc/modules that is
cat /etc/modules
here is the link http://pastebin.com/d59b7f5b5
hm.. ok, so the buggy driver isn't loaded by this mechanism. looks normal. did you run any 'setup.sh' or other install script from your downloaded package ?
do u want to have a look at the cam driver?
so it's quite hard to track down how the driver slipped in your configuration, b/c you actaully did not understand waht you were doing. what does uname -r return ?
try sudo apt-get install-reinstall linux-image-2.6.22-14-generic . this will reinstall the kernel , and i hope this will undo the misconfiguration. try to reboot after that.
sudo apt-get install --reinstall linux-image-2.6.22-14-generic .
which command should i use? the first one or the second?
second one is correct
of course... but a reinstall will of course wipe your ubuntu partition, so backup any data that you might need
thanks a lot, re installation has finished, will c u soon bye
